sent_1.text: Trunk exercise combined with spinal manipulative or NSAID therapy for chronic low back pain : a randomized , observer-blinded clinical trial .

entity_1.text: Trunk exercise combined with spinal manipulative or NSAID therapy

sent_2.text: OBJECTIVES To study the relative efficacy of three different treatment for chronic low back pain ( CLBP ) .

sent_3.text: Two preplanned comparisons were made : ( a ) Spinal manipulative therapy ( SMT ) combined with trunk strengthening exercises ( TSE ) vs. SMT combined with trunk stretching exercises

entity_5.text: Spinal manipulative therapy ( SMT ) combined with trunk strengthening exercises ( TSE )

sent_4.text: , and ( b ) SMT combined with TSE vs. nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drug ( NSAID ) therapy combined with TSE .

entity_8.text: anti-inflammatory drug ( NSAID ) therapy combined with TSE .

sent_5.text: STUDY DESIGN Interdisciplinary , prospective , observer-blinded , randomized clinical trial with a 1-yr follow-up period .

sent_6.text: The trial evaluated therapies in combination only and was not designed to test the individual treatment components .

sent_7.text: SETTING Primary contact , college out-patient clinic .

sent_8.text: PATIENTS In total , 174 patients aged 20-60 yr were admitted to the study .

sent_9.text: MAIN OUTCOME MEASURES Patient-rated low back pain , disability , and functional health status at 5 and 11 wk .

sent_10.text: INTERVENTIONS Five weeks of SMT or NSAID therapy in combination with supervised trunk exercise , followed by and additional 6 wk of supervised exercise alone .

entity_15.text: NSAID therapy in combination with supervised trunk exercise

sent_11.text: RESULTS Individual group comparisons after 5 and 11 wk of intervention on all three main outcome measures did not reveal any clear clinically important or statistically significant differences .

sent_12.text: There seemed to be a sustained reduction in medication use at the 1-yr follow-up .

sent_14.text: Continuance of exercise during the follow-up year , regardless of type , was associated with a better outcome .

sent_15.text: CONCLUSION Each of the three therapeutic regimens was associated with similar and clinically important improvement over time that was considered superior to the expected natural history of long-standing CLBP .

sent_16.text: For the management of CLBP , trunk exercise in combination with SMT or NSAID therapy seemed to be beneficial and worthwhile .

entity_26.text: trunk exercise in combination with SMT or NSAID therapy

sent_17.text: The magnitude of nonspecific therapeutic ( placebo ) effects , cost-effectiveness and relative risks of side effects associated with these types of therapy need to be addressed in future studies
